page.title: 18PRINCES RISBOROUGH CARNIVAL
page.content: The Carnival used to be a regular annual event in Princes Risborough, usually organised by the local round table. However in the late 1970's enthusiasm began to ware, and after a carnival in the Queen Silver Jubilee of 1977 there were no more. That is until saturday 8th june 1985. Once again the town got itself organised for it's Summer carnival, of course everyone hoped for good weather, the previous Saturday had been beautiful & a repeat performance was required. The weather was fair,not good, but at least it did not rain. The procession consisited of 12 floats, the band of a local boys brigade plus vintage cars and a group of majorettes. The carnival Queen, a local 16 year schoolgirl rode in the precession and then judged the fancy dress competition, also there are aerobatics.
